body_html:
OK so, are these equivalent? Perhaps I am misunderstanding partition_strategy.

If they are not equivalent, could (per your comment on things being confusing as I suggested) docs should be added to embedding_lookup to clarify how to set partition_strategy, given a PartitionedVariable?

my_embedding_var = tf.get_variable(..., partitioner=fixed_size_partitioner, ...)

x = tf.embedding_lookup(my_embedding_var, ..., partition_strategy='mod', ...)

my_embedding_var = tf.get_variable(..., partitioner=fixed_size_partitioner, ...)

x = tf.embedding_lookup(my_embedding_var, ..., partition_strategy='div', ...)

OK so, are these equivalent?  Perhaps I am misunderstanding partition_strategy.
If they are not equivalent, could (per your comment on things being confusing as I suggested) docs should be added to embedding_lookup to clarify how to set partition_strategy, given a PartitionedVariable?
my_embedding_var = tf.get_variable(..., partitioner=fixed_size_partitioner, ...)

x = tf.embedding_lookup(my_embedding_var, ..., partition_strategy='mod', ...)

my_embedding_var = tf.get_variable(..., partitioner=fixed_size_partitioner, ...)

x = tf.embedding_lookup(my_embedding_var, ..., partition_strategy='div', ...)
body:
OK so, are these equivalent?  Perhaps I am misunderstanding partition_strategy.  

If they are not equivalent, could (per your comment on things being confusing as I suggested) docs should be added to embedding_lookup to clarify how to set partition_strategy, given a PartitionedVariable?

```
my_embedding_var = tf.get_variable(..., partitioner=fixed_size_partitioner, ...)

x = tf.embedding_lookup(my_embedding_var, ..., partition_strategy='mod', ...)
```

```
my_embedding_var = tf.get_variable(..., partitioner=fixed_size_partitioner, ...)

x = tf.embedding_lookup(my_embedding_var, ..., partition_strategy='div', ...)
```
